alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 20 at 12:35PM MST until March 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to increased snow melt, combined with heavy rainfall in lower elevation creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain, snowmelt, and excessive runoff remains possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following areas, in east central Arizona, Northern Gila County. In west central Arizona, Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons and Yavapai County Valleys and Basins. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
